get.description: Status returns the current setup status. This is usually only relevant in the installation phase.

200.description: Status represents the current setup status.

400.description: Bad request is usually returned, if you have missing or wrong formatted parameter.

500.description: Internal Server Error is usually returned, if something went wrong at the server side. If this problem persists, you should contact the support, to get more insight.

200.description: Status represents the current setup status.

400.description: Bad request is usually returned, if you have missing or wrong formatted parameter.

500.description: Internal Server Error is usually returned, if something went wrong at the server side. If this problem persists, you should contact the support, to get more insight.

causedBy.description: CausedBy is optional and may reference another error which is the root of this error. This builds a chain of error to understand the flow and context of the failure better.

details.description: Details is optional and may contain arbitrary details which are unique for a specific error case. It may contain machine readable information to give a user help to solve the problem.

id.description: Id is unique per error category and can be mapped to a specific error case which can be solved in a distinct way.

localizedMessage.description: LocalizedMessage is optional and should only be there if it is worth to show it to the user, because it is already translated and offers an understandable explanation or solution.

message.description: Message helps the developer to understand what was wrong. It should never be used to determine which kind of error happened. Use the Id instead.

type.description: Type helps the developer to understand what is wrong. It represents an implementation details.

Error.description: Error describes a nested server error, with messages and causes, types and unique ids.

Message.description: a textual representation as a developer notice

Status.description: Status represents the current setup status.
